intro: Sahagunia, commonly known as the "Mexican sunflower," is a genus of flowering plants native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange petals and dark brown central disk. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Sahagunia species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are also used in traditional medicine. They thrive in full sun and well-drained soil, making them suitable for gardens and landscapes in warm climates.
